Pressure: The pressure at the bottom of the ocean is extreme, which can cause physical discomfort and even damage equipment.
Communication challenges: The pressure and distance from the surface can make communication difficult, especially if the team relies on surface-based equipment.
Risk of drowning: Diving to such depths poses a risk of drowning, especially if the team gets separated or equipment malfunctions.
Marine life: The ocean is home to a vast array of marine life, some of which could be dangerous or pose a threat to the team.
Water temperature: The water at the bottom of the ocean can be extremely cold, causing hypothermia if the team is not adequately protected.
